page.title: 02CHURCHES IN WEDMORE
page.content: {St.Marys Church}is a perpendicular church made of local stone and its building took place between 1350 and 1570. It is situated on a slight hill next to the manor house. It has been added to and moved since it was built and is no longer its original cross shape.It has many interesting features inside.At the west end is a window to commemorate the Peace of Wedmore.There is a stone altar which was found after being buried in the reign of Elizabeth I. Above the pulpit are three mural paintings on top of each other.The top one shows St.Christopher with Jesus on his back and a lighthouse.{ {Wedmore Methodist Church}This Wesleyan Chapel was built in 1817 with help from John Tonkin.It's made interesting by the plasterwork and Georgian organ. {Baptist Church}built in 1857.Wedmore Baptist congregation founded in 1600.
